org_name: Michigan Medicine - University of Michigan Health

request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Copies of a Medical Record
Fax to Release of Information Unit
Mail to Revenue Cycle Mid Service (HIM)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic ROI authorization PDF that includes a dedicated 'Myself' section for self-requests, with free delivery available via the MyUofMHealth Patient Portal.

red_flags: Prepayment language ('personal use may require a prepayment') could be read to include patient self-requests, potentially conflicting with HIPAA's prohibition on conditioning access on payment
Outdated 2011 version of the form remains publicly accessible and search-indexed with no deprecation notice
bright_spots: Free patient portal delivery prominently promoted with 'No Cost Services' callout
Package-based record selection system simplifies choosing which records to request
Vendor transparency: names Vital Chart (VRC) as records fulfillment vendor so patients expect communications from them
Transparent fee schedule with separate patient vs. third-party rate structures

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form was easily found via basic web search with direct download links; no site navigation required, though the uninformative filename (ROI_.pdf) is a minor issue.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Form has a text layer but zero fillable fields despite digital design; patient must print and handwrite, then submit via fax â€” usable digitally with workarounds but not a seamless digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized numbered sections with logical flow and a helpful package-based record selection system; minor issues with cross-section referencing complexity and dense legal language in some passages.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient self-access is clearly accommodated via the dedicated 'Myself' option (item 2) with tailored delivery methods, and the free portal pathway is prominently promoted, even though the form serves multiple purposes.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Voluntariness, revocation rights, and fees are transparently disclosed; minor ambiguity in prepayment language that could be read to apply to patient self-requests, and patient electronic delivery fee ($6.89) is close to but not clearly justified under HIPAA cost-based limits.

overall.summary: Michigan Medicine provides a well-organized, findable ROI form that clearly accommodates patient self-access and promotes a free portal pathway, but the lack of fillable PDF fields and ambiguous prepayment language prevent it from reaching the top tier.
